attributes.action: apologise for the blatant attempt of the UK Government to smear the reputation of General Sir Richard Dannatt
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Through the use of parliamentary questions raised by Lord Foulkes, the government have been exposed as wanting to smear the good reputation of General Sir Richard Dannatt. 

This is because of his strident and very valid criticism of this Government's lack of support for army personnel.

At the end of General Sir Richard Dannatt's tenure as the head of the Army, it was predicted by many people that the government would stoop to this low level because of the previous criticism.

Attempting to smear General Sir Richard Dannatt in this way is deplorable. 

Gordon Brown should reprimand Lord Foulkes and publicly apologise to General Sir Richard Dannatt for this slur.

reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
